fastBigMath

Class BigMathHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • fastBigMath.BigMathHelper

  • public class BigMathHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains a series of helper methods which provide subroutines aiding in the calculation of the operations defined in the classes BigMathSimple and BigMathAdvanced.
    Version:
    05/12/2016
    Author:
    Chaitanya Varier

    • Method Detail

      • checkIsEqual

        public static boolean checkIsEqual(int[] arr1,
                                   int[] arr2)
        Checks if two arrays are equal.
        Parameters:
        arr1 - the first integer array
        arr2 - the second integer array
        Returns:
        true - If arr1 = arr2
        false - If (arr1 != arr2)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the arrays are of different lengths or are null.

      • checkIsGreaterThan

        public static boolean checkIsGreaterThan(int[] arr1,
                                         int[] arr2)
        Compares whether one integer array is greater than another of the same length (ie. whether arr1 > arr2). This method assumes arr1 != arr2.
        Parameters:
        arr1 - the first integer array
        arr2 - the second integer array
        Returns:
        true - If arr1 > arr2
        false - If (arr1 <= arr2)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the integer arrays contain more than a single digit in each element
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the integer arrays are not of equal length or at least one is null or contains zero elements

      • padZeroes

        public static int[] padZeroes(int[] arr,
                              int numZeroes)
        Inserts a specified number of single digit zero elements to the beginning of an integer array.
        Parameters:
        arr - the integer represented by an integer array.
        numZeroes - the number of zeroes to be padded.
        Returns:
        the processed array padded with the specified number of zeroes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the int[] representing the integer parameter contains more than a single digit in each element
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the int[] representing the integer parameter is null or of length 0

      • removePaddedZeroes

        public static int[] removePaddedZeroes(int[] arr)
        Removes the leading single digit zero elements from an integer array.
        Parameters:
        arr - the integer represented by an integer array.
        Returns:
        the processed array stripped of its leading single digit zero elements.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the int[] representing the integer parameter contains more than a single digit in each element
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the int[] representing the integer parameter is null or of length 0

      • toArray

        public static int[] toArray(java.lang.String str)
        Converts an arbitrarily large integer represented by a String to an integer array.
        Parameters:
        str - the integer represented by a String.
        Returns:
        an integer array containing the separated digits of the integer represented by the String parameter. Each element in the array contains a single digit.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the String representing the integer parameter contains anything but the numeric characters from 0-9
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the String representing the integer parameter is null or of length 0

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(int[] arr)
        Converts an arbitrarily large integer represented by an integer array to a String. Each element in the array must contain a single digit.
        Parameters:
        arr - the integer represented by an integer array.
        Returns:
        a String representing the integer from the integer array parameter.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the int[] representing the integer parameter contains more than a single digit in each element
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the int[] representing the integer parameter is null or of length 0
